info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 9:39PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Accumulating wet snow for some areas late tonight into the morning commute on Tuesday... Light snow will develop over the eastern Catskills and some rain and snow showers over the mid Hudson Valley after midnight. The rain and snow showers will spread across the southern Taconics, southern Berkshires and Litchfield Hills through daybreak Tuesday. Precipitation will be primarily wet snow in the higher peaks of the eastern Catskills, southern Taconics, southern Berkshires and Litchfield Hills, with mostly rain showers in the mid Hudson Valley and southern Litchfield County area. Localized amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible late tonight into Tuesday morning in higher terrain with a dusting in the valleys. Most snow accumulations should be on grassy and elevated surfaces due to the initially warm ground temperatures, but there is potential for untreated roads and bridges to become slick heading into the morning commute as air temps drop to around freezing.
